message.content:
Like most screenwriting software, Final Draft includes a variety of features that simplify and streamline the scriptwriting process. Some of these key features include:

1. Industry-standard formatting: Final Draft automatically formats your script to industry standards, making it easy for writers, producers, and directors to read and collaborate on the document.

2. Script templates: The software provides customizable templates for various types of scripts (e.g., film, TV, stageplay) adhering to different formatting guidelines.

3. Character navigator: This feature allows users to track every character’s dialogue throughout their story easily by listing each character's lines with a simple click.

4. Scene navigator: Provides an overview of all scenes in your screenplay - giving you easy access when organizing or revising content.

5. Index cards: With digital index cards available in Final Draft 12, you can outline your story virtually – allowing you to move whole sections around seamlessly within your draft without disturbing others' elements inside each scene.

6. Collaboration tools: Real-time collaboration allows multiple authors/editors simultaneously work together on projects while tracking changes made by everyone involved—a boon when deadlines are tight!

7.Region-specific language support:Easily switch between languages like English (with UK/US dictionaries), Spanish & French so that different members within international teams feel comfortable while writing up reports/documents or creating invoices/scripts that vary based on country requirements

8.Text-to-speech:return Enhanced Text-to-Speech with selectable voices—letting you listen back as your screenplay is read out loud section-by-section even if time limitations preclude full re-reads themselves—an essential aspect which facilitates proofreading/exploratory editing sessions done conveniently from home computing setups where dual-monitor configurations may not prove sufficient during lengthy copy edits/etcetera despite
